name: Tiny Game #2: Moving Platforms
description:
Summary:  This is the 2nd tiny game that I successfully completed via an Unreal Engine tutorial. The tutorial is a few years old and made for UE4, but I built it in UE5.  I am building a total of 9 games purely from UE5 tutorials, in order to learn the basics of the engine. This particular game which I call 'Moving Platforms' is another very simple game that shows off some basic UE features.  The tutorial I followed is Creating Your First Game in Unreal Engine 5 on Udemy, which is currently free. You can build the same game by following the tutorial too! 

Installing and Running: Download the zipped file, then unzip the file. Run the TinyGame2.exe executable file, and the game should begin! 

Gameplay Directions: You are a mannequin. Congrats! But now you have to reach the platform on the far upper right with a table & two chairs. The moving platforms that look like big garden planters move back & forth, and you can jump on them to reach the destination. Alert: The big platforms can't hold your weight, and fall down after about 15 seconds!  

Controls:

  1. To move, use WASD along with your mouse to 'mouselook'. 
  2. To jump, press the Spacebar! 
  3. To pause the game and bring up the list of keys, press 'P' for pause.
  4. To restart the level if you get stuck, just press 'R'.
  5. To quit the game, simply press the Backspace button (or '<-Back' )
